reviews.review_msg: Really great prof: I wasn't interested in theory at all but he makes it interesting, engaging, and accessible.
Best prof I had at SFU and an amazing person.

Avoid this professor. There were no helpful lectures, just reading from her script. The questions she asks in class or for your writing are so confusing, and she doesn't know how to help you. On the other hand, she is a very tough grader, and her expectations are so high, despite her low teaching quality. Her class is extremely boring.

She makes lectures mandatory but they offer nothing of substance to your learning. Not only are they boring and useless, but your passing of this course is dependent on you showing up even if you have handed in all your work and did decently on them, which is absurd. Content is presented in a confusing way and her explanations of them do nothing.

Unpopular in our class. Calls on students to answer specific questions in class, like high school.  Attendance policy harsh. In class work not particularly  interesting/relevant. Narrow focus on civil rights, few opportunities to explore  other movements. Weekly posts were not demanding. Not difficult but this course deserves better.

Very unorganized, and had to buy 3 books that were mandatory to use. He also forced students to attend seminars and said would fail (recieve N) if you skipped more than 3 classes. Lectures were boring and felt like they did not help a lot, most classes had a film to watch that did not feel relevant at times. Take this class with another prof.

Cynthia is an awesome professor! Although the class was quite "dry" at some points she is a great prof that really takes the time to help. I felt a bit discouraged after my first 2 papers but Cynthia took the time to really go through everything with me and made me work hard for my grade. Awesome person and the class was interesting.

Absolutely amazing prof, the best I've had at sfu! She is a very fair mark, gives thorough feedback, and really gets to know all of her students personally. She really pushes you to do your best and doesn't put any time restraints on assignments. very understanding and approachable... her outlines and criteria are a bit vague for assignments tho.
There is so much justice in Baran's teaching and the course content! The course is so aware of what's happening globally. With every class, I find what is delievered so timely and needed.

This course turned out to be one of the best classes I've had. I really like how Baran managed class discussions. though I wish there was more lecture, but overall the course structure and Baran's delivery never left anything unclear or confusing. They love assigning movies, so be ready to watch a good number of them!
Baran was a major slay! Would deffo take them again!!!!! No exam queen!!!!!! Gurl do not skip this classssssssss attendance matters slayyyy
Baran is amazing! It was one of best classes I've had and I recommend everyone to take their classes!

Assignments- repetitive/boring, instead of giving constructive feedback her critiques are condescending/discouraging.I have 3.75 GPA and never received higher than a B from her. Current events at beginning of class are informative but seems as though she does not like to lecture and leaves the work to students. Class is purely on theory alone
